content.description:
Head up a thin crack to a roof. Pass the roof on its right side. Follow a wider crack up past a hollow downward pointing flake, then up and left along discontinuous cracks.

Climb ends at a nice tree with great views of the lake. For fun you can top out with a 5.0 pitch. Otherwise, head back to a rap station 50' behind the tree.

I think the start may be a tad harder than 10a, but I'll go with the guide rating here.
content.protection: All sorts, small to large.  Some good opportunities for passive pro.

content.description:
Dirty thin crack within a chimney that ends at a belay tree.

Belay from a tree and either rap or scramble off to descend.
content.location: Starts up and right of Zorro and identified as a thin crack in a chimney.

content.description: Climb onto a ledge about 8â€™ off the ground and start up up a small dihedral covered in hard moss to gain Access to the twin cracks. Climb the excellent left hand crack that goes from hands to off hands at the top. At the end of the crack, go up and right onto the arete to finish the climb. No bolt and tricky gear anchor. Climbers can choose to walk off from the top or head south to bolt anchors for a rappel.
content.protection: Gear to 3". Anchor requires large gear rope for slinging large boulders
content.location: The location is on the north east side of castle rock
